Text.Value: And you will not even be able to defend yourself. If you kill him, the Absolute will enthral you.
*Despite your best attempts to be subtle, the mind flayer's awareness is everywhere. You blunder in its presence like a worg pup learning to walk.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
The player, being physically in the Astral plane, enters a full-blown battle. Before us, 4 of Orpheus' guards fight against a mind flayer, The Emperor/Daisy.

The Emperor holds his hands up, they are buzzing with psionic energy. He is trying to recreate the globe of domination with one hand, and uses telekenis with the other to fling a stone toward the guards.

One of the guards kicks the stone to the side, following through to knock the Emperor down toward the player.
EditorData.SFXTags: [KB] Emperor creates Globe of Domination (L Hand), , Emperor flings rock psionicly (R Hand), Rock breaking, Punch IntDev, , IntDev blood spew and splatter on geometry, , Orpheus bindings ambience, , Battle ambience, general battle impact foley, Emperor getting kicked, lands rough
EditorData.VFXTags: [KB] Emperor creates Globe of Domination (L Hand), , Emperor flings rock psionicly (R Hand), Rock affected by psionic powers, , Monk hand glows as they break the rock, and punches the IntDev, , IntDev blood spew and splatter on geometry, , Orpheus bindings (refer to Kick-Off Doc), , Orpheus glowing eyes, Plume of dust as Emperor gets knocked hard to the ground, , Monk glow of legs/feet as he strikes the Emperor, ,

Text.Value: HAPPY? Now. Join me. FIGHT.
Leave the githyanki alone!
You are in danger indeed, mind flayer. What the hells is happening?
Join the mind flayer's fight.
You must be joking. I am TELLING you my thoughts. Directly. Into. Your. Head.
Together we can turn the tide.
Prove to me that you are who you say.
We are more alike than you want to admit. Look past it. I know you don't want to, but you must.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: In the absence of the globe of domination we see the chains that bind Orpheus stop glowing. Orpheus’ head straightens to its natural position as he ‘awakens’. A closeup on Orpheus’ face as his eyes roll back to their natural state. He is ‘free’ of the Emperor’s psionic control (though still unable to move.)
EditorData.StateChangeTags: [KB] Orpheus loses eye glow, Orpheus bindings decrease in glow/diminishes
EditorData.VFXTags: [KB] Orpheus loses eye glow, Orpheus bindings decrease in glow/diminishes

Text.Value: This is the battle you were fighting?
I told you about my room in the Elfsong Tavern, that night when you held me. I was vulnerable - you comforted me.
The githyanki is the source of our protection against the Absolute. I MUST subdue him or everything we've worked towards is lost.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Orpheus. His eyes lock on us.

Text.Value: No.
Die, monster!
Before you do anything - I am your ally.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: From the ground, the Emperor locks eyes with us and speaks.

Text.Value: Don't let my form deceive you. I am the one that's been protecting you. I am the one that came to you in your dreams.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Emperor getting to his feet.

Text.Value: The honour guard - eliminate them. My forces are weakened by their assault. But with your help, we can turn this around.
We are in DANGER.
You're a mind flayer.
That was awful. Just awful. You haven't even IMPROVED since your last attempt!

EditorData.logicalname: Tried to read Emperor's mind before

Text.Value: You let me live, last time you were here. Though it brought Vlaakith's wrath upon you.
You slept with the drow Minthara. You pleased her.
Oh, shit. A mind flayer?
Destroy the guard. I will subdue their master.
You shared an intimate night with the drow, Minthara.
*As the horror subsides, you are left with only one coherent thought - you must do whatever you can to subdue the githyanki.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: We see the player reeling as the mindmeld ends before they get back to their feet, woozily.

Text.Value: Try to read the mind flayer's thoughts.
I don't believe you. You're a mind flayer.
FOOL. Without me you will perish!
*Nothing in your colourful existence to date could have prepared you for this.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor closes his eyes. The player enter a mindmeld with them. The connection is held briefly then they drop to one knee, mentally overwhlemed.
EditorData.VFXTags: [KB] Mindmeld with the Emperor and Player

Text.Value: Ghaik abomination! By the One True Sky, what is this madness?
I am not your enemy.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor pins its gaze on us, a mix of fear and anger.

Text.Value: Help me.
I AM THE REASON YOU ARE FREE.
Then you would betray yourself and all your allies? Without me you will perish!
The last time you were here, you tried to kill me. Not far from this very spot.
Now HELP ME!
A mind flayer. Godsdamned abomination!
Fight with me. Your future depends on it!
Explain yourself, illithid, or we will end you.

EditorData.NodeContext: unnerved but in control as the party encounter an illlithid that claims to be their ally - situation is tense and urgent

Text.Value: The guard. Destroy the guard. They prevent me from subduing their master.
How do I help?
What do you need me to do?
I should have known. This wasn't the first time you tried to kill me.
I will not betray my people!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
The globe stops forming.

At the centre, Orpheus is chained (with VFX lightning chains) to a rock by the infernal shackles he wears, unmoving, his eyes rolled back to the whites (or equivalent cool VFX suggesting he is subdued.) His head is also snapped back so that he looks unseeing at the sky.

Text.Value: A mind flayer? What's going on here?!
You must be joking. Look around you - we are at WAR.
But without me, you will perish!
You saved a child from a viper, back in the druids' grove.
Do NOT be driven by fear! Trust me now and I promise you will have all the answers you seek.
I want no part in the slaughter of innocents.
I want no part in the slaughter of my kin.
Attack the mind flayer.
Your continued existence as yourself and not a mind flayer should be all the proof you need.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Intellect devourers swarm the guards, and the battle moves away from the player and Emperor.

Text.Value: I will do it.
A mind flayer? What the blazes is going on here?
Your blind loyalty will be your undoing, Lae'zel. Fight with me. For your own survival.
Finally.
You saved the aasimar Nightsong from her soul cage.
Enough. Die.
You do not understand. He will attack anyone that reeks of illithid - that includes YOU.
But if you insist on taking a look for yourself, BE MY GUEST.
I'm not helping a mind flayer.
You killed the aasimar Nightsong. You didn't have to.
You BETRAYED me.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor is really struggling now that we have attacked him.
EditorData.logicalname: Agreed to help Emperor then attacked him

Text.Value: Another tentacled freak? What in the hells is this?
Aid an illithid against githyanki? We cannot, we must not!
A mind flayer? What foul trickery is this?
Do it. NOW.

Synopsis: The Emperor tries to get you to help it destroy Orpheus' royal guard so that it can subdue Orpheus again. If you side with the Emperor, you fight against the githyanki with the help of the Emperor and the intellect devourers. If you side with the githyanki, the Emperor feels betrayed and will teleport you back to the material plane where you have a few turns to get back inside the portal and some githyanki to kill on your way.
